source.name: NBC News

author: David Gura
title: Not extending $600 unemployment benefit 'would be a catastrophe,' say former Fed Chairs Bernanke and Yellen
description: Not extending $600 unemployment benefit 'would be a catastrophe,' former Fed Chairs Bernanke and Yellen tell Congress in a hearing on the economic response to the coronavirus crisis.
content: With expanded unemployment insurance set to expire at the end of the month, two former chairs of the Federal Reserve urged lawmakers to renew the emergency benefits created in the early days of the c… [+4038 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: Reuters
title: Polish 'LGBT-Free' town weighs risk of losing EU funds
description: About a hundred towns across rural Poland that have declared to be free of “LGBT ideology,” reflecting a backlash against gay rights throughout the nation.
content:
KONSKOWOLA, Poland Surrounded by fields of roses and lavender in tranquil eastern Poland, some residents of the village of Konskowola feel the European Union may be trying to blackmail them.
Like ab… [+4258 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: Dareh Gregorian
title: Trump says 'I don't agree' with CDC director's mask message
description: The president continued his muddied messaging on face coverings, saying "masks cause problems too," but also, "I think masks are good."
content: President Donald Trump on Friday continued muddying his administration's messaging on the use of masks to combat the spread of the coronavirus, saying he disagreed with his CDC director about how eff… [+2225 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Swarm of locusts threaten livelihood of millions in African, Asian and Middle Eastern countries
description: NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on the swarms of locusts in Africa and Asia that are devouring farmlands and threatening millions of people’s livelihoods as they struggle to deal with the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Lester Holt on coronavirus pandemic: ‘We’re in this together’
description: As front line workers and researchers fight to save as many lives as possible, Lester Holt reflects on the role all Americans play in beating the virus.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: 100-year-old veteran Captain Tom Moore knighted by Queen Elizabeth
description: Captain Thomas Moore, the World War II veteran who raised $40 million for Britain’s health system by walking 100 laps around his garden, is now Sir Thomas Moore after the Queen knighted him as a congratulations for his extreme act of kindness.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Supreme Court declines to overturn Florida voting rules for felons
description: The U.S. Supreme Court declined to make it easier for convicted felons in Florida to vote if they haven’t paid all their court fines. Critics fighting for the right to vote say requiring payments is a twist on old Jim Crow laws.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: 15 women allege sexual misconduct by former Washington NFL team employees
description: According to the Washington Post, 15 former team employees say they were harassed by high-level executives with the team over a period spanning more than a decade. The team has hired a private law firm to conduct an independent review of the claims.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Pentagon effectively bans Confederate flag
description: Defense Secretary Mark Esper announced Friday that the flag is no longer allowed to be publicly displayed on any military installations.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Ginsberg receiving treatment for cancer recurrence
description: Justice Ginsberg revealed that she began chemotherapy in mid-May for a recurrence of cancer, which is yielding positive results. She said she will continue to serve on the Supreme Court.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Coronavirus: States debate how to safely start the school year
description: As some school districts announce a “Hybrid Learning” model of teaching, others have decided to go completely online until it is safe enough to return. Many teachers and parents worry about the safety in the classroom, while some experts fear possible dangers…
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Georgia governor defends lawsuit against Atlanta mayor over city’s face mask mandate
description: In the lawsuit, Governor Kemp calls the mandate “unenforceable,” and is also moving to stop Atlanta from rolling back reopening measures. Mayor Bottoms calls the suit “bizarre.”
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Coronavirus cases continue surging across southern U.S. as death toll nears 140,000
description: A report sent to states by the White House coronavirus task force, and obtained by Center for Public Integrity, suggested more than a dozen states should roll back some reopening plans to attempt to limit the spread of the virus.
source.name: NBC News

author: Andrea Cavallier
title: Disappearance of Oklahoma mother remains a mystery more than two decades later
description: Sherryl Lynn Jacquot, 43, was last heard from on July 3, 1999 when she called her mother from an unknown number in Arkansas to let her know she’d come by her house in Oklahoma City to give her some money. She never made it. She was last seen by her mother and…
content: Sherryl Jacquot always wore red lipstick. She wore her long, dark hair teased and hair sprayed as high as possible. Her designer jeans were always starched so stiff they could stand up on their own. … [+7810 chars]
